item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Those who will play with cats must expect to be scratched." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Of all God's creatures, there is only one that cannot be made slave of the leash. That one is the cat. If man could be crossed with the cat it would improve the man, but it would deteriorate the cat." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "The way to get on with a cat is to treat it as an equal - or even better, as the superior it knows itself to be." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Sarah Williams
item.description: "I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night." -- Sarah Williams

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In the first place God made idiots. This was for practice. Then he made school boards." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "How did it get so late so soon?" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Jane Hamilton
item.description: "It is books that are a key to the wide world; if you can't do anything else, read all that you can." -- Jane Hamilton

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "Children need models rather than critics." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The highest result of education is tolerance" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Marian Wright Edelman
item.description: "It is the responsibility of every adult... to make sure that children hear what we have learned from the lessons of life and to hear over and over that we love them and that they are not alone." -- Marian Wright Edelman

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Elizabeth Stone
item.description: "Making the decision to have a child - it is momentous. It is to decide forever to have your heart go walking around outside your body. " -- Elizabeth Stone

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "To bring up a child in the way he should go, travel that way yourself once in a while." -- Josh Billings

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "Don't worry that children never listen to you; worry that they are always watching you." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Homer
item.description: "It behooves a father to be blameless if he expects his child to be." -- Homer

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Bette Davis
item.description: "If you have never been hated by your child, you have never been a parent." -- Bette Davis

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "If there is anything that we wish to change in the child, we should first examine it and see whether it is not something that could better be changed in ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Charles R. Swindoll
item.description: "Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children." -- Charles R. Swindoll

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Charles R. Swindoll
item.description: "Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it." -- Charles R. Swindoll

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Haim Ginott
item.description: "If you want your children to improve, let them overhear the nice things you say about them to others." -- Haim Ginott

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Diane Loomans
item.description: "If I had my child to raise all over again, I'd build self-esteem first, and the house later. I'd finger-paint more, and point the finger less. I would do less correcting and more connecting. I'd take my eyes off my watch, and watch with my eyes. I'd take more hikes and fly more kites. I'd stop playing serious, and seriously play. I would run through more fields and gaze at more stars. I'd do more hugging and less tugging." -- Diane Loomans

item.title: Ms. J add a quote by Karl Menninger M.D.
item.description: "What's done to children, they will do to society." -- Karl Menninger M.D.
